H0.text: factories that assemble parts made in other countries. Free Trade Areas

H1.text: factories that assemble parts made in other countries. Export Processing Zones

H2.text: factories that assemble parts made in other countries. Industrial Parks

H3.text: factories that assemble parts made in other countries. special economic zones

A4.text: These zones are often used by multinational corporations to set up factories to produce goods (such as clothing, shoes, and electronics).

A5.text: Export-processing zone (EPZ) is a specific type of FTZ usually set up in developing countries by their governments to promote industrial and commercial exports.

A6.text: Hualingfiz.ge Free Industrial Zone List of Free Zones in United Arab Emirates

A7.text: These zones attracted investment from multinational corporations and allowed export-oriented Chinese businesses to respond quickly to demand in foreign markets.

A8.text: In some countries, the zones have been criticized for being little more than labor camps, with workers denied fundamental labor rights.
